content:
Diagnosis:		Bilateral breast cancer with widespread metastases

Primary Disease:	Right breast: T4N3M1 oncocytic carcinoma, PDL1 85%, AR+
			Left breast: T2N1M0 invasive ductal carcinoma, triple negative

Metastases:		Multiple brain metastases (largest 2.8cm right parietal)
			Widespread bone metastases including C5 vertebra
			Bilobar liver metastases (>10)

Treatment History:	Jan 2024: Whole brain radiotherapy 20Gy/5#
			Feb 2024: Started carboplatin/gemcitabine
			Mar 2024: Cycle 2 delayed due to neutropenia

Current Status:	PS 3, deteriorating. MRI brain 12/4/24 shows progressive disease with new lesions?

Complications:	Grade 4 neutropenia requiring admission?
		Spinal cord compression at C5 requiring urgent radiotherapy?
		Worsening liver function (bilirubin 45)?

Plan:			Discontinue systemic therapy
			Urgent palliative care review
			Consider hospice admission

primary_cancer.metastases: multiple brain metastases (largest 2.8cm right parietal), widespread bone metastases including C5 vertebra, bilobar liver metastases (>10)

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows progressive disease with new lesions

status_updates.value: Bilateral breast cancer with widespread metastases showing disease progression despite treatment. Significant clinical deterioration with multiple complications.
Decision to discontinue systemic therapy due to disease progression and complications
Urgent palliative care review and consider hospice admission
